Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain."},"bridgeERC20To(address,address,address,uint256,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ERC20 tokens to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain."},"bridgeETH(uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ETH to the sender's address on the other chain."},"bridgeETHTo(address,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Sends ETH to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if ETH is sent to a         smart contract and the call fails, the ETH will be temporarily locked in the         StandardBridge on the other chain until the call is replayed. If the call cannot be         replayed with any amount of gas (call always reverts), then the ETH will be         permanently locked in the StandardBridge on the other chain. ETH will also         be locked if the receiver is the other bridge, because finalizeBridgeETH will revert         in that case."},"constructor":{"notice":"Constructs the L2PatexBridge contract."},"deposits(address,address)":{"notice":"Mapping that stores deposits for a given pair of local and remote tokens."},"finalizeBridgeERC20(address,address,address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Finalizes an ERC20 bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         StandardBridge contract on the remote chain."},"finalizeBridgeETH(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Finalizes an ETH bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         StandardBridge contract on the remote chain."},"finalizeBridgeETHDirect(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Modified StandardBridge.finalizeBridgeETH function to allow calls directly from         the L1PatexBridge without going through a messenger.See { StandardBridge-finalizeBridgeETH }"},"initialize(address)":{"notice":"Initializer"},"messenger()":{"notice":"Messenger contract on this domain. This public getter is deprecated         and will be removed in the future. Please use `messenger` instead."},"otherBridge()":{"notice":"Getter for the remote domain bridge contract."}},"notice":"The L2PatexBridge is responsible for transfering ETH and USDB tokens between L1 and         L2. params._amount: Amount of local tokens to deposit.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._amount: Amount of local tokens to deposit.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum amount of gas that the bridge can be relayed with.

params._amount: Amount of the ERC20 being bridged.
params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                     not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                     to identify the transaction.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC20 on this chain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the corresponding token on the remote chain.

params._extraData: Extra data to be sent with the transaction. Note that the recipient will                   not be triggered with this data, but it will be emitted and can be used                   to identify the transaction.

OTHER_BRIDGE().notice: Corresponding bridge on the other domain.

bridgeERC20(address,address,uint256,uint.notice: Sends ERC20 tokens to the sender's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain.

bridgeERC20To(address,address,address,ui.notice: Sends ERC20 tokens to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if the         ERC20 token on the other chain does not recognize the local token as the correct         pair token, the ERC20 bridge will fail and the tokens will be returned to sender on         this chain.

bridgeETH(uint32,bytes).notice: Sends ETH to the sender's address on the other chain.

bridgeETHTo(address,uint32,bytes).notice: Sends ETH to a receiver's address on the other chain. Note that if ETH is sent to a         smart contract and the call fails, the ETH will be temporarily locked in the         StandardBridge on the other chain until the call is replayed. If the call cannot be         replayed with any amount of gas (call always reverts), then the ETH will be         permanently locked in the StandardBridge on the other chain. ETH will also         be locked if the receiver is the other bridge, because finalizeBridgeETH will revert         in that case.

deposits(address,address).notice: Mapping that stores deposits for a given pair of local and remote tokens.

finalizeBridgeERC20(address,address,addr.notice: Finalizes an ERC20 bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         StandardBridge contract on the remote chain.

finalizeBridgeETH(address,address,uint25.notice: Finalizes an ETH bridge on this chain. Can only be triggered by the other         StandardBridge contract on the remote chain.

finalizeBridgeETHDirect(address,address,.notice: Modified StandardBridge.finalizeBridgeETH function to allow calls directly from         the L1PatexBridge without going through a messenger.See { StandardBridge-finalizeBridgeETH }

messenger().notice: Messenger contract on this domain. This public getter is deprecated         and will be removed in the future. Please use `messenger` instead.

otherBridge().notice: Getter for the remote domain bridge contract.

ERC20BridgeFinalized(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when an ERC20 bridge is finalized on this chain.

ERC20BridgeInitiated(address,address,add.notice: Emitted when an ERC20 bridge is initiated to the other chain.

ETHBridgeFinalized(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when an ETH bridge is finalized on this chain.

ETHBridgeInitiated(address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when an ETH bridge is initiated to the other chain.

userdoc.notice: The L2PatexBridge is responsible for transfering ETH and USDB tokens between L1 and         L2. In the case that an ERC20 token is native to L2, it will be escrowed within this         contract.
